title.narrative: Emergency Shelter Support Response and Sealing off Kits to IDPs and People Living in Critical Shelter Conditions in Mosul and surrounding area

description.narrative:
In line with Iraq Humanitarian Pool Fund (IHPF) 2017 first standard allocation paper and the S-NFI Cluster Specific Guidance, UN-Habitat will distribute 2,500 emergency shelter kits as first-line response and 3,000 sealing off kits as second-line response targeting people living out-of-camps and in critical conditions and returnees who do not have resources to improve their shelter conditions in and around Mosul. The project will directly benefit 33,000 people, including 9,000 women, 8,000 men, 8,000, girls and 8,000 boys in Mosul area. The average cost per beneficiary is USD 18.
The project will, as first-line response, ensure displaced families and vulnerable population living in critical shelter conditions have safe, appropriate emergency shelter by distributing pre-positioned emergency shelter kits and as second-line response, upgrade and repair basic shelters of vulnerable population through fast-track procurement and distribution of sealing off kits.
UN-Habitat will consider the critical gaps in the targeted areas in consultation with the S-NFI Cluster to direct its response, ensure adequate coverage and avoid duplication of activities with other cluster partners, while ensuring the necessary flexibility to adapt the response according to the needs.
UN-Habitat will partner with local NGOs to carry out distribution of emergency shelter kits and sealing off kits in Mosul (security permitting) and in the surrounding areas. These pre-selected local NGOs are long term partners with experience in implementing shelter kits distribution in Mosul area. This approach will ensure UN-Habitat has the capacity to timely respond to critical needs. Protection and gender mainstreaming will be central in selecting the beneficiaries during distributions and people most in need will be prioritized, including female-headed households, households with disabled people and elderly.
